QUESTION 14) A standard should only want to validity when all who may be concerned with it reaches (or may arrive), as participants in a practical discourse, to an agreement as to the validity of this norm.
HABERMAS, J. Moral conscience and act communicative. Rio de Janeiro: Brazilian Time, 1989.
According to Habermas, the validity of a standard must be established by
A) Human freedom, which consecrates the will.
B) Communicative reason, which requires consensus.
C) philosophical knowledge, which expresses the truth.
D) scientific technique, which increases the power of man.
E) political power, which focuses on the party system.
